name: Sepilok Nature Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in between our Lankayan visit and Kinabatangan. We arrived approximately 9am and we able to check in straight away. As we had come from Lankayan at 6am we were tired so this was really welcomed!
reviews.title: A nice stay.
Amazing experience with wildlife and nature
reviews.text: There are not many facilities around the resort, and we were a bit disappointed by the lunch options as we were told that only buffet food was available for lunch (we were getting pretty tired of buffets by this point). For dinner though, we did get an a la carte menu which was greatly appreciated!!

The rooms are nice, some are very far away from reception though and unfortunately the journey to our chalet with our suitcases was tiring and we ended up losing the wheels from one, which made the journey back doubly tiring!!
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay and a short walk to the Orang Utan centre

reviews.text: We didnt really feel that the resort offered much in terms of things to do, but I expect this is because people come here for the Orangs and not much else. As a result we had very little to do and found ourselves being a little bored during the afternoon.
reviews.title: Sepilok Nature Resort - nearly excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and must say that some people must have gotten very unlucky as I am here with my partner and 2 friends and we are very happy with everything. The rooms are basic, yes, but very clean. The staff is friendly. The water is boiled so there is no issue with becoming sick. We are 5 minutes away from the Sepilok Orang Utang rehabilitation centre and we were lucky enough to see 10 of them while apparently when you see 4 it's a good day. Yes, it gets crowded in the morning so go in the afternoon.
reviews.title: One night is not enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have mainly great comments to make about the Sepilok Nature Resort, but a few suggestions for improvement.
reviews.title: Excellent overall experience but room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid for a package deal with included room, full meals, a night jungle tour, a trip to the Orang Utan rehabilitation centre, and the Labuk Bay Proboscis Monkey sanctuary.
reviews.title: The best stay in Borneo we've had

reviews.text: The good
reviews.title: Sepilok Nature Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Service*
reviews.title: Beautiful rainforest retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say the service we received was top notch, they really looked after us and did everything they could to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Very friendly, genuine people. All of them - really, everyone we encountered.
reviews.title: Amazingly beautiful Gardens, interesting Wildlife and lovely Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the main reason we stayed here. It is only 15 minutes easy walk to get into the Sepilok Orang Utan Rehab centre and its viewing platforms. The chalet rooms are comfortable and the air con worked well. There is no swimming pool or other amenities and the lounge upstairs from the dining area is used as a junk store. This is a shame since it would be a great spot for an evening beer. The food was good but not outstanding and the service friendly. Its best feature are the amazingly nice gardens and the huge array of wild flowers on display. Two nights is probably sufficient for most people and although we enjoyed our stay we were pleased to move on to somewhere with more to see and do.
reviews.title: A great place to walk to the Orang Utan Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night when visiting the Orang Utang orphanage.
reviews.title: Great location but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a location point of view it couldn't be better. Right next door and 5 mins walk.
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room though was rather odd. We had a large chalet consisting of lounge/diner, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom - all open plan.
reviews.title: Lovely place & gardens, but missing something...

reviews.text: However, it was located amongst the staff quarters with no view to speak of.
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night whilst on our travels through Borneo and it was part of a package. As we had our yearly Anniversary and I let the staff know this before, they kind of upgraded us into a huge villa and welcomed us so nicely.
reviews.title: GREAT Retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They prepared a bath full of flowers for us and the whole bed was with flowers, really sweet. And everybody of the staff knew that we had anniversary and congratulated us.
reviews.title: Nice but some minor complaints

reviews.text: It is perfectly located it is directly next to the Orang-Utan Center, don't miss the 3pm feeding and do the Night Jungle Walk, even if it is a bit expensive, but it is a great experience. As you just step out into the jungle and 5 meters from the bungalows we already saw our first snakes and that went on for the full hour.....
reviews.title: Jungle noises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing, the food options are minimal if you are not taking the BBQ buffet which is very expensive as well.
reviews.title: A rain forest paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you’re used to luxury city accommodation or exclusive beach resorts and just come here to see the orang-utans, you have to know things are different here as it’s more a lodge than a resort. There ‘s no swimming pool and the only restaurant serves either a fixed menu or buffet. But when you’re completing your checklist of worldwide wildlife, Sepilok Nature Resort really is a luxurious place when you compare it to for example the lodging in some destinations in Africa or Latin America. Though the air-conditioned cottages lack a writing desk – which in my opinion is more a necessity than the television (who needs TV here?) – they do have a coffee/tea maker, a ceiling fan, large beds, a veranda and a safety locker. However, don’t expect everything to be perfect. In our cottage (where we stayed early May for 2 nights), some of the former occupants thought to be funny to close the safety locker before leaving. When we reported this at the reception, they immediately sent a mechanic to fix this. And yes, with our own eyes we saw how safe a safety locker with a 4-digit code was. The man had absolutely no problem in opening it with his master key but as it wasn’t possible to enter 4 new digits, we still couldn’t use it. Moral of the story: don’t think the locker in your room is absolutely secure! It’s not safer than entrusting your valuables to the receptionist! Anyway, you would be extremely unfortunate to be robbed here, so it’s safe – though a bit uncomfortable – to carry your money and passports on your body while you’re going to see the orang-utans. Perhaps you may also become interested to join the night walk. We didn’t, as we thought it to be extremely expensive. While you may well expect to see interesting species, if your itinerary includes places such as Sukau and Kinabatangan River, Tabin Wildlife Reserve or Danum Valley, it’s probably better to save your money as a guided night walk in any of these places is much, much cheaper – and probably even better. Regarding the birds on the lodge premises, we cannot say avifauna was particularly abundant – but it’s likely you can spot here several spectacular species such as pied hornbill, stork-billed kingfisher and black-and-red broadbill.
reviews.title: Someone in charge is taking the...

description: Hidden amongst a veritable treasure trove of tropical plants and grasses, hug trees and spectacular orchids in bloom, the quaint bungalows of the Sepilok Nature Resort are within walking distance of the world-famous Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve, precious home of the last wild Orang Utans of Northern Borneo. Combining rich traditional style with contemporary luxury, Sepilok Nature Resort is the ideal starting point for most other wildife land destinations in Sabah such as the fauna rich Kinabatangan River and the surrounding Sukau area.
